
# Resources

Below is a short list of references we find useful for learning theoretical computer science and related mathematics.  
They are roughly grouped into **Books** and **Websites / Online Notes**.

---

## Books



<div class="resource-grid">

<div class="resource-card">
  <h3>Sipser – Introduction to the Theory of Computation</h3>
  <p>
    Standard introduction to automata, computability, and complexity. Very readable and widely used in theory courses.
  </p>
  <p>
    <a href="https://example.com/sipser">More details →</a>
  </p>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h3>Arora & Barak – Computational Complexity</h3>
  <p>
    A modern, more advanced treatment of complexity theory, suitable for reading groups once basic concepts are in place.
  </p>
  <p>
    <a href="https://example.com/arora-barak">More details →</a>
  </p>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h3>Hopcroft–Motwani–Ullman – Automata Theory</h3>
  <p>
    Classic text on automata, formal languages, and computability with many examples and exercises.
  </p>
  <p>
    <a href="https://example.com/hopcroft">More details →</a>
  </p>
</div>

<div class="resource-card">
  <h3>Additional References</h3>
  <p>

  </p>
